Events and trends
* 589 BCâApries succeeds Psamtik II as king of Egypt.
* 588 BCâNebuchadrezzar II of Babylon begins siege of Jerusalem; the opera
  [[Nabucco]] sets the date at 587 BC.
* 587 BCâJerusalem falls to the Babylonians, ending the Kingdom of Judah. The
  conquerors destroy the Jewish Temple of Jerusalem and exile some of the land's
  inhabitants.
* 586 BCâDeath of Zhou ding wang, King of the Zhou Dynasty of China.
* 28 May 585 BCâA solar eclipse occurs as predicted by Thales, while Alyattes II
  is battling Cyaxares. This leads to a truce. This is one of the cardinal dates
  from which other dates can be calculated.
* 585 BCâLucius Tarquinius Priscus, king of Rome, defeats the Sabines in war,
  takes the town of Collatia, and celebrates a triumph for his victories on 13th
  September.
* 585/584 BCâAstyages succeeds Cyaxares as King of the Medes.
* 585 BCâZhou jian wang becomes King of the Zhou Dynasty of China.
* 585 BCâFall of the Kingdom of Urartu following a Median invasion. (The
  Scythians ruined the Kingdom of Urartu.)
* 582 BCâMilitary clash of the major Classical antiquity powers Egypt
  and Babylon.
* 582 BCâPythian Games reorganised at Delphi. (This is the traditional date.)
* 581 BCâIsthmian Games founded at Corinth.
* 580 BCâCambyses I succeeds Cyrus I as king of Anshan and head of the
  Achaemenid dynasty. (approximate date)
* c. 580 BCâGorgon Medusa, detail of sculpture from the west pediment of the
  Temple of Artemis, Korkyra, is made. It is now at the Archaeological Museum of
  Corfu. *c. 580 BCâStanding Youth (Kouros) is made. It is now at The
  Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York.
